instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 00840 not waking from deep sleep
threads.message: This Mac operates normal except for when it is sleep for while it won't wake up with key press or power button press: the backlight comes on with no image. It will wake up if I close the lid and wait a bit and reopen. I did PRAM resets and update. I tried messing with some settings via terminal but issue persists. Although lid behaviour is normal, just in case I checked Lid/rt. & left hall sensors and SMC ON/OFF and all are at 3.4V.

threads.title: 00840 not waking from deep sleep
threads.message:
Did you try with another macOS installation?
An USB test version maybe...
Discard software problem first.

threads.title: 00840 not waking from deep sleep
threads.message:
So the problem only appear when the machine goes to sleep by time, not closing the lid?

Try flashing known good full BIOS, clean ME.

threads.title: 00840 not waking from deep sleep
threads.message:
From what I can tell, it is solved from just clean ME. I have tried roughly dozen times and it is no longer hanging up and waking as it should.

Thanks!

threads.title: 00840 not waking from deep sleep
threads.message:
Thanks for feedback.
This may help other forum members; the ones who take notes...
